title: Data Analyst (Modelling)
text:
Closes: 27th October 2015 
The UK Health Forum modelling team has been working for the last eight years developing a micro-simulation model of lifestyle risk factors and related chronic diseases, which has been applied in over 70 national settings in the UK, US, Mexico, Brazil, the Russian Federation as well as local settings in the UK. The team has collaborated with the CDC, OECD, WHO and NICE. Details of their work is available at www.ukhealthforum.org.uk 
We are looking for an experienced data analyst with a deep interest in public health to join our small team of epidemiologists, programmers and researchers. The candidate should have the following skills: 
Essential Master’s in Epidemiology, Medical Statistics or Applied Statistics Complex survey design and methods e.g. raking Highly proficient in the use of statistical software such as STATA, R Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team Ability to accurately judge priorities Highly proficient computer skills – Microsoft office Excellent organizational and communication skills 
Highly desirable PhD in Epidemiology, Medical Statistics or Applied Statistics High level of report writing and presentational skills 
Desirable Database development e.g. use of SQL Knowledge of programming languages such as C++ Publication track record 
This is a full-time, one-year fixed term position with the possibility of further extended employment, subject to funding, based at the UK Health Forum offices in Blackfriars, central London. The contract is subject to a three month probationary period. 
The UK Health Forum (UKHF) is a UK alliance of national organisations working with and through our members for the prevention of avoidable chronic diseases and related conditions. 
If you wish to apply, please send a covering letter and a CV, marked Private and Confidential to Laura Webber at laura.webber@ukhealthforum.org.uk or by post to: Laura Webber, UK Health Forum, Fleetbank House, 2-6 Salisbury Square, London, EC4Y 8JX by Tuesday 27 th October 2015 . The interviews will be held on Friday 30 th October 2015. 
If you wish to discuss this position please contact Laura Webber in the first instance on 020 7832 6935. 
Only applicants with a right to work in the UK need apply. 
We are an equal opportunities employer. Please let us know if you require any adjustments to enable you to apply or attend an interview. Share this job
